entities.description: m3docvqa is a dataset used for evaluating performance in document question answering
exact match is a metric used to measure performance in document question answering
layout   vanilla is a model that consistently outperforms vanilla rag by preserving layout information
vanilla rag is a baseline model used for comparison in retrieval augmented generation tasks
tree traverse is a model that relies on hierarchical navigation and shows suboptimal results
graphranker is a model that uses graph based reasoning and shows suboptimal results
bookrag is a superior model that uses a unified tree graph bookindex and agent based planning for precise retrieval and generation
tree graph bookindex is a unified indexing structure used by bookrag for effective evidence retrieval
agent based planning is a technique used by bookrag to configure optimal workflows for query processing

relations.description: layout   vanilla consistently outperforms vanilla rag  indicating its superior performance in preserving structural information
bookrag utilizes the tree graph bookindex as part of its architecture for effective evidence retrieval
bookrag employs agent based planning to configure optimal workflows and overcome limitations of static query processing
bookrag overcomes the limitations of tree traverse  which relies solely on hierarchical navigation
bookrag overcomes the limitations of graphranker  which relies solely on graph based reasoning
exact match is used as a performance metric on the m3docvqa dataset
